brand_info.name: Microsoft
brand_info.tagline: to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more
brand_info.positioning: A global technology platform company delivering cloud, productivity, devices, and developer tools that enable people and organizations to create, build, and operate securely at scale.
brand_info.mission: to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more
brand_info.origin_story: Founded on April 4, 1975 by Bill Gates and Paul Allen in Albuquerque, New Mexico, originally focused on software for early personal computers and expanding into operating systems, productivity, cloud, and developer platforms.

brand_values.brand_promise: Practical optimism: technology that expands human capability and turns ideas into real outcomes.
differentiators: End-to-end ecosystem across cloud, productivity, and developer tools
Human-centered design systems (Fluent) emphasizing clarity and accessibility
Enterprise-grade trust posture with security as a core priority
non_negotiables: No deceptive claims or misleading product representation

psychographics.lifestyle: Knowledge workers, creators, developers, students, and business leaders balancing productivity, creativity, and collaboration
psychographics.behavior: Adopts tools that reduce friction and enable collaboration; expects familiar, intuitive experiences across devices and contexts

tone_of_voice.communication_style: Direct, benefit-led, and possibility-driven; short statements that invite action
tone_dos: Keep copy succinct with generous breathing room
tone_donts: Overly poetic or abstract language without a clear benefit

logo.primary_logo: Microsoft four-square symbol with Microsoft wordmark (Segoe-based)
logo.usage_rules: Logo must be clear, legible, and separated from other elements with consistent clear space; avoid distortion, effects, or low-contrast placement.
logo.lockup_behavior: Typically top-left or bottom-left for campaign materials; can be used as a small, stable anchor away from the main headline.
logo.safe_area: Minimum clear space equal to the height of the capital “M” in the logotype (or equivalent symbol-height rule for lockups).

color_system.color_usage_rules: Use bold Microsoft core colors as accents and anchors; pair with expansive neutrals and soft gradients to create warmth and approachability; keep contrast high for readability.

layout_principles.grid_system: Modular grid with strong alignment; common use of center-weighted headline blocks and asymmetric negative space
layout_principles.image_vs_text_balance: Text-led or balanced; large statement text with a single strong visual anchor
layout_principles.cta_placement: Top-right small URL/CTA or bottom corner near brand mark; never competes with the headline
layout_principles.alignment: Left-aligned or centered headlines; brand lockup stays consistent and understated

style.camera_feel: Everyday life made iconic through simple composition, crisp focus, and a single conceptual twist (split worlds, overlays, or shape masks).
style.pose_guidelines: Natural movement and purposeful gestures; confident but approachable expressions; activity-driven posture over posed glamour.
style.casting_attitude: Inclusive, contemporary, and relatable; diverse representation presented as normal and unforced.

technical.lighting: Bright natural daylight or soft studio; clean highlights with controlled shadows
technical.color_grading: Neutral with warm lifts; frequent use of brand-tinted gradients and color fields

preferred_locations: Simple outdoor landscapes with big skies

model_casting.attitude: Focused, curious, energetic; optimism without exaggeration

product_presentation.hero_visibility: Brand and message lead; product appears as contextual enabler rather than the sole hero
product_presentation.styling_approach: Contemporary, functional, and context-true; minimal styling that supports relatability
avoid: Overly technical product callouts in primary headlines

motion_rules.pacing: Smooth, efficient transitions; short beats that feel modern and frictionless
motion_rules.transitions: Soft wipes, gradient fades, and shape-based reveals aligned with Fluent motion principles

visual_dos: Use soft gradients and shape masks as brand signifiers
Use inclusive human moments grounded in real environments
visual_donts: Heavy visual effects that reduce clarity
copy_dos: Simple verbs that imply progress (build, create, imagine, connect)
copy_donts: Ambiguous metaphors without a clear takeaway

can_evolve: Use of conceptual overlays and shape language
test_zone: Abstract brand shape systems for sub-brands like Microsoft Advertising

digital.tone_adjustment: More utility-forward and instructive on web; more punchy and headline-driven on social

platform_behavior.Instagram: Bold statements over clean gradients; human moments with a single concept device
platform_behavior.Website: High-clarity hierarchy, accessible contrast, generous whitespace
platform_behavior.Newsletter: Short headlines, clear sections, strong CTA hierarchy

print.paper: Uncoated or matte stock with high color fidelity for gradients
print.cover_rules: Large headline, minimal supporting copy, logo anchored with ample clear space

logo_misuse_examples: Drop shadow or bevel on logo
Placing logo on low-contrast gradient areas
Using the logo inline within sentences
